instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message:
It consumes 0.02a, then sometimes it jumps to 0.14a
  
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.56v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5.03v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> 0v

SCL/SDA resistance lines of battery bus 0.565.
SCL/SDA voltage lines of battery bus 3.3v.
SMC/<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>. 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> 3v3 drop to 0.3v when i short <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground.
don't boot with SMC bypass mode

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> 3v3 drop to 0.3v when i short <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground "
Check for pulse at all <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SX_L</SIGNAL> signals at same time.
Be sure <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> is steady high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> is always high

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> is 0 and then go to high 0.8v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is 0 and then go to high 0.8v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> is 0 and then go to high 0.8v
<SIGNAL>PCH_PM_SLP_S0_L</SIGNAL> Is always high

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message: Then check for pulse at all big coils, as <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message:
when i trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> no pules on the big coils. but already the board try to boot, then here there is pulses on the big coils
"as <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> too." there is a coil for this signal?
by the way, it is zero

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message:
At the moment of pulse on big coils, check for pulse at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.
If the signal appears on schematic/boardview, matters where you check it?
Of course, no coil for it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message:
I can't find any pulses on the big coils, there is a pulses at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.

The board water damaged, but it was booting before. After i put it in the ultrasonic cleaner. It stopped to boot and not S4 state.

Once i fixed this problem by reflowing the CPU, but in this model when i reflow it, the cpu is bending, do anyone know how reflow it with this issue ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message:
If you suspect accumulated crap under VGA chips, no need to reflow.
Heats until 180-200 degrees no more; you don't need to melt the balls.
Of course, quality flux is importamt; throw away the "chinese honey".

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message: i am using amtech, i reflowed the CPU no result, what to try next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, it try to start
threads.message: Probably some trace broken, or knocked off component in the UC process...
